greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with the sequence [1, 1/2, 1/3, ..., 1/n]; form new sequence of n-1 terms by taking averages of successive terms; repeat until reach a single number F(n); a(n) = denominator of F(n).
comment: a(n) is the denominator of the resistance of the n-dimensional cube between two adjacent nodes, when the resistance of each edge is 1. See Nedermeyer and Smorodinsky. - _Michel Marcus_, Sep 13 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3312 (first 200 terms from T. D. Noe)
F. Nedermeyer and Y. Smorodinsky, <a href="http://static.nsta.org/pdfs/QuantumV7N1.pdf">Resistance in the multidimensional cube/a>, Quantum, Sept/October 1996, pp. 12-15 (beware file is 75Mb).
maple: a:= n-> denom(coeff(series(2*log((x/2-1)/(x-1)), x, n+1), x, n)):
program: avg xs = zipWith (\x x' -> (x + x') / 2) (tail xs) xs
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 13 2003
